creator: Pierre.van.Rooden@omroep.nl
text:
When I specify a manifest file in the <jar > command, that manifest file is
added unchanged to the META-INF directory.
This is different from specifying a manifest file on the jar commandline (with
-m filename), since the latter adds information to the manifest: the
Manifest-Version and Created-By fields.
It would be desirable if the <jar > command would make use of the -m parameter
of jar, rather than copy the file.
Fixed. Jar task now merged the manifest with the standard fields.

OK, this latest concept is slightly different from the original bug report. When
you update a jar and provide a manifest you are saying you want the manifest to
look like what you have given it. There is currently no way to merge a new
manifest into a jar's existing manifest (might be nice). 

Note that the manifest you have supplied
Class-Path: jce1_2_1.jar sunjce_provider.jar US_export_policy.jar local_policy.jar

have been merged with the standard fields to become
Manifest-Version: 1.0
Created-By: Ant 1.4.1
Class-Path: jce1_2_1.jar sunjce_provider.jar US_export_policy.jar loca
 l_policy.jar

This was the essence of the original bug report. The jar task will merge a file
manifest, an inline manifest and the default manifest to arrive at the manifest
to put into the jar. When you update a jar, this manifest will be the manifest
of the updated jar. The jar's original manifest is not involved.
